channel.title: Course Info on Class Homepage
channel.description: Recent content in Course Info on Class Homepage

item.title: Course Overview
item.description: Course Overview # Important CSE students should note that CS 7641 is not allowed as a substitute for the CSE core course CSE 6740, and that they cannot get credit for both CSE 6740 and CS 7641. This course introduces techniques in machine learning with an emphasis on algorithms and their applications to real-world data. We will investigate the following question: how to computationally extract useful knowledge from data for decision making and task support!

item.title: Instructor and TAs
item.description: Instructors and TAs # Instructor # Max Mahdi Roozbahani mahdir@gatech.edu https://mahdi-roozbahani.github.io/ Head TAs # Huili Huang hhuang413@gatech.edu TAs # Parisa Babolhavaeji pbabolhavaeji3@gatech.edu Neda Tavakoli ntavakoli6@gatech.edu Matthew Lau mlau40@gatech.edu Zongao Bian zbian30@gatech.edu

item.title: Course Schedule
item.description: Schedule # Important All deadline and due dates in this course will be at 23:59 ET. Scroll horizontally to see the full schedule table on mobile devices Astericks (*) indicate that the lecture slides/notes are available. Week Dates Topics Homework Quizzes Project Readings 1 5/15 - 5/19 *Course Overview (L1) *Linear Algebra (*Notes, L2) Q0 - L1 | Q1 - L2 GT Honor Code; Heilmeier catechism; Visual Information Theory by Chris Olah; GitHub Pages; YAML Configuration; Overleaf for GT students; Linear Algebra Review by Zico Kolter; 2 5/22 - 5/26 *Prob and Stats (*Notes, L3) *Info Theory (Notes, L4) A1 out 5/22 Q2 - L3 | Q3 - L4 | Syllabus Quiz Project team composition due 5/26 Independence, Coorelation, Orthogonality Correlation vs Covariance; The Differences Between Data, Information and Knowledge Cross Entropy as loss function More about Cross Entropy and KLD; Probability Theory Review by Andrew Moore; 3 5/29 - 6/2 Optimization (L5) Toolbox - P1 (L5) Memorial Day Holiday Q4 - L5 NumPy Tutorial; Matplotlib Tutorial; seaborn: statistical data visualization; KKT for inequality constrained optimization; Why Cross Entropy over MSE for Classification; Gradient Descent short video; Matplotlib Tutorial; NumPy Tutorial; 4 6/5 - 6/9 Clustering & K-Means (Notes L7) Hierarchical Clustering (Notes L7) GMM - Part 1 (Notes L8) A1 due 6/9 A2 out 6/9 Q5 - L7 | Q6 - L8 Curse of dimensionality (Euclidean space example); Jupyter Notbook (Kmeans and DBSCAN); Understanding the concept of Hierarchical clustering Technique; Dendrogram Visualization; GitHub Student Application 5 6/12 - 6/16 GMM - Part 2 (Notes L9-A) DB SCAN (Notes L9-B) Clustering Eval (Notes L10-A) Density Estimation (Notes L10-B) Q7 - L9, L10-A (Density Estimaion NOT included) Project proposal due 6/16 Peer Evaluation 6/16 Jupyter Notbook (Kmeans and DBSCAN); KDE interactive visualization; KDE sampling; KDE SKLearn and sampling; Jupyter Notebook Kernel Density Example; 6 6/19 - 6/23 Juneteenth Holiday Density Estimation - Contd (Notes L10-B) Dimension Reduction (Notes L11) Q8 - L10-B (Density Estimaion included), L11 Image reconstruction using PCA; Feature extraction using PCA; PCA for images; PCA as linear combination of features; PCA and Linear Discriminant Analysis; 7 6/26 - 6/30 Linear Regression (Notes L12) Regularization (Notes L13) A2 due 6/30 A3 out 6/30 Q9 - L12, L13 Simple Linear Regression in Matrix Format; Adding Noise to Regression Predictors; 8 7/3 - 7/7 Student Recess Holiday NB & Logistic Reg (Notes L14) Q10 - L14 Project midpoint report 7/7 Peer Evaluation 7/7 9 7/10 - 7/14 Neural Networks (Notes L15) CNN (Notes L16) A3 due 7/14 A4 out 7/14 Q11 - L15, 16 NN Playground Interactive NN initialization; The role of a hidden layer; Back propagation numerical example; More detailed introduction; CNN Live Demo; A guide to an efficient way to build CNN and optimize its hyper-parameters; Back Propagation in CNN; Transfer learning in CNN; Project Scoring Guidance; 10 7/17 - 7/21 DT (Notes, L17) RF (Notes, L17) SVM (Notes, L18) Q12 - L17 | Q13 - L18 11 7/24 - 7/25 SVM-Kernel (Notes, L19) Final Instructional Day A4 due 7/25 can submit till 7/28 without any penalty Final Project due 7/25 can submit till 7/28 without any penalty Peer Evaluation due 7/25 KKT and SVM *Ethics in ML Final Class days (July 24 and 25)
